intro: Polyalthia agusanensis, commonly known as the Agusan mountain flame tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the Philippines, specifically found in the mountainous regions of Mindanao. The plant is characterized by its striking red and orange flowers that bloom in clusters, giving it a fiery appearance. It typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
